system.description:
You are so at home in the wilds and with the gifts of your divine patron that you have come to think of all the world as a temple. You gain the following benefits:

  • Your Wisdom score increases by +1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You ignore the speed penalty from all forms of difficult terrain. If there is an additional effect such as damage or requiring a save to avoid falling prone, it affects you as normal.
  • When you acquire this feat, choose a creature type from the following list: Aberrations, Celestials, Fey, Fiends, or Undead. The chosen creature type always counts as your studied adversary in addition to your normal choice.
  • When you cast a cleric spell, if you have no spell slots remaining, you immediately gain 4 points of exertion and 2 uses of Trained Accuracy. Once you have used this benefit, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.
